text: A life scarce worth the living, a poor fame
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Scarce worth the winning, in a wretched land,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Where fear and pain go upon either hand,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: As toward the end men fare without an aim
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Unto the dull grey dark from whence they came:
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Let them alone, the unshadowed sheer rocks stand
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Over the twilight graves of that poor band,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Who count so little in the great world's game!
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Nay, with the dead I deal not; this man lives,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: And that which carried him through good and ill,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Stern against fate while his voice echoed still
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: From rock to rock, now he lies silent, strives
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: With wasting time, and through its long lapse gives
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Another friend to me, life's void to fill.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: of Njal and his sons, a work in our estimation to be placed beside

text: After this comes the birth of Grettir, and anecdotes (one at least
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sufficiently monstrous) of his unruly childhood; then our hero kills
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his first man by misadventure, and must leave Iceland; wrecked on
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: an isle off Norway, he is taken in there by a lord of that land, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there works the deed that makes him a famous man; the slaying of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: villainous bearserks, namely, who would else have made wreck of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: honour and goods of Grettir's host in his absence; this great deed,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: we should say, is prefaced by Grettir's first dealings with the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: supernatural, which characterise this Saga, and throw a strange light
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: on the more ordinary matters throughout. The slaying of the bearserks
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: is followed by a feud which Grettir has on his hands for the slaying
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of a braggart who insulted him past bearing, and so great the feud
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: grows that Grettir at last finds himself at enmity with Earl Svein,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the ruler of Norway, and, delivered from death by his friends, yet
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: has to leave the land and betake himself to Iceland again. Coming back
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there, and finding himself a man of great fame, and hungry, for more
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: still, he tries to measure himself against the greatest men in the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: land, but nothing comes of these trials, for he is being reserved for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a greater deed than the dealing with mere men; his enemy is Glam
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the thrall; the revenant of a strange, unearthly man who was himself
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: killed by an evil spirit; Grettir contends with, and slays, this
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: monster, whose dying curse on him is the turning-point of the story.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: All seems fair for our hero, his last deed has made him the foremost
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: man in Iceland, and news now coming out of Olaf the Saint, his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: relative, being King of Norway, he goes thither to get honour at
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his hands; but Glam's curse works; Grettir gains a powerful enemy by
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slaying an insulting braggart just as he was going on ship-board; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: on the voyage it falls out that in striving to save the life of his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: shipmates by a desperate action, he gets the reputation of having
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: destroyed the sons of a powerful Icelander, Thorir of Garth, with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their fellows. This evil report clings to him when he lands in Norway;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and all people, including the King from whom he hoped so much, look
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: coldly on him. Now he offers to free himself from the false charge by
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the ordeal of bearing hot iron; the King assents, and all is ready;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: but Glam is busy, and some strange appearance in the church, where
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the ordeal is to be, brings all to nothing; and the foreseeing Olaf
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: refuses to take Grettir into his court, because of his ill-luck. So
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he goes to his brother, Thorstein Dromund, for a while, and then goes
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: back to Iceland. But there, too, his ill-luck had been at work, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: when he lands he hears three pieces of bad news at once; his father is
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: dead; his eldest brother, Atli, is slain and unatoned; and he himself
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: has been made an outlaw, by Thorir of Garth, for a deed he has never
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: done.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: He avenges his brother, and seeks here and there harbour from his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: friends, but his foes are too strong for him, or some unlucky turn of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fate always pushes him off the help of men, and he has to take to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wilderness with a price upon his head; and now the other part of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: curse falls on him heavier, for ever after the struggle with the ghost
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he sees horrible things in the dark, and cannot bear to be alone, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: runs all kinds of risks to avoid it; and so the years of his outlawry
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: pass on. From time to time, driven by need, and rage at his unmerited
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ill-fortune, he takes to plundering those who cannot hold their own;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: at other times he lives alone, and supports himself by fishing, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: is twice nearly brought to his end by hired assassins the while.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Sometimes he dwells with the friendly spirits of the land, and chiefly
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with Hallmund, his friend, who saves his life in one of the desperate
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fights he is forced into. But little by little all fall off from him;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his friends durst harbour him no more, or are slain. Hallmund comes
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to a tragic end; Grettir is driven from his lairs one after the other,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and makes up his mind to try, as a last resource, to set himself
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: down on the island of Drangey, which rises up sheer from the midst
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Skagafirth like a castle; he goes to his father's house, and bids
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: farewell to his mother, and sets off for Drangey in the company of his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: youngest brother, Illugi, who will not leave him in this pinch, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a losel called "Noise," a good joker (we are told), but a slothful,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: untrustworthy poltroon. The three get out to Drangey, and possess
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: themselves of the live-stock on it, and for a while all goes well;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the land-owners who held the island in shares, despairing of ridding
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: themselves of the outlaw, give their shares or sell them to one
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorbiorn Angle, a man of good house, but violent, unpopular, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unscrupulous. This man, after trying the obvious ways of persuasion,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: cajolery, and assassination, for getting the island into his hands, at
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: last, with the help of a certain hag, his foster-mother, has recourse
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to sorcery. By means of her spells (as the story goes) Grettir wounds
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: himself in the leg in the third year of his sojourn at Drangey,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and though the wound speedily closes, in a week or two gangrene
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: supervenes, and Grettir, at last, lies nearly helpless, watched
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: continually by his brother Illugi. The losel, "Noise," now that the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: brothers can no more stir abroad, will not take the trouble to pull
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: up the ladders that lead from the top of the island down to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: beach; and, amidst all this, helped by a magic storm the sorceress
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: has raised, Thorbiorn Angle, with a band of men, surprises the island,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unroofs the hut of the brothers, and gains ingress there, and after
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a short struggle (for Grettir is already a dying man) slays the great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outlaw and captures Illugi in spite of a gallant defence; he, too,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: disdaining to make any terms with the murderers of his brother, is
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slain, and Angle goes away exulting, after he had mutilated the body
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Grettir, with the head on which so great a price had been put, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the sword which the dead man had borne.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But now that the mighty man was dead, and people were relieved
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of their fear of him, the minds of men turned against him who had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: overcome him in a way, according to their notions, so base and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unworthy, and Angle has no easy time of it; he fails to get the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: head-money, and is himself brought to trial for sorcery and practising
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: heathen rites, and the 'nithings-deed' of slaying a man already dying,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and is banished from the land.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now comes the part so necessary to the Icelandic tale of a hero, the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: revenging of his death; Angle goes to Norway, and is thought highly of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for his deed by people who did not know the whole tale; but Thorstein
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Dromund, an elder half-brother of Grettir, is a lord in that land, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Angle, knowing of this, feels uneasy in Norway, and at last goes away
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to Micklegarth (Constantinople), to take service with the Varangians:
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorstein hears of this and follows him, and both are together at last
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in Micklegarth, but neither knows the other: at last Angle betrays
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: himself by showing Grettir's sword, at a 'weapon-show' of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Varangians, and Thorstein slays him then and there with the same
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: weapon. Thorstein alone in a strange land, with none to speak for him,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: is obliged to submit to the laws of the country, and is thrown into a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: dungeon to perish of hunger and wretchedness there. From this fate he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: is delivered by a great lady of the city, called Spes, who afterwards
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: falls in love with him; and the two meet often in spite of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: watchful jealousy of the lady's husband, who is at last so completely
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: conquered by a plot of hers (the sagaman here has taken an incident

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: CHAP. I.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There was a man named Onund, who was the son of Ufeigh Clubfoot, the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: son of Ivar the Smiter; Onund was brother of Gudbiorg, the mother of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Gudbrand Ball, the father of Asta, the mother of King Olaf the Saint.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund was an Uplander by the kin of his mother; but the kin of his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: father dwelt chiefly about Rogaland and Hordaland. He was a great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: viking, and went harrying west over the Sea.[4] Balk of Sotanes, the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: son of Blaeng, was with him herein, and Orm the Wealthy withal, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Hallvard was the name of the third of them. They had five ships, all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: well manned, and therewith they harried in the South-isles;[5] and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: when they came to Barra, they found there a king, called Kiarval, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he, too, had five ships. They gave him battle, and a hard fray there
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was. The men of Onund were of the eagerest, and on either side many
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fell; but the end of it was that the king fled with only one ship.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So there the men of Onund took both ships and much wealth, and abode
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there through the winter. For three summers they harried throughout
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Ireland and Scotland, and thereafter went to Norway.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: [Footnote 4: "West over the Sea," means in the Sagas the British
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: isles, and the islands about them--the Hebrides, Orkneys, &c.]
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: [Footnote 5: South-isles are the Hebrides, and the other islands down
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to Man.]

author: NA

text: CHAP. II.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: In those days were there great troubles in Norway. Harald the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Unshorn,[6] son of Halfdan the Black, was pushing forth for the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kingdom. Before that he was King of the Uplands; then he went north
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: through the land, and had many battles there, and ever won the day.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thereafter he harried south in the land, and wheresoever he came,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: laid all under him; but when he came to Hordaland, swarms of folk came
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thronging against him; and their captains were Kiotvi the Wealthy, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorir Longchin, and those of South Rogaland, and King Sulki. Geirmund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Helskin was then in the west over the Sea; nor was he in that battle,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: though he had a kingdom in Hordaland.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: [Footnote 6: "Harald the Unshorn:" he was so called at first because
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he made a vow not to cut his hair till he was sole king of Norway.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: When he had attained to this, and Earl Rognvald had taken him to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bath and trimmed his hair, he was called "Fair-hair," from its length
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and beauty.]
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now that autumn Onund and his fellows came from the west over the Sea;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and when Thorir Longchin and King Kiotvi heard thereof, they sent men
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to meet them, and prayed them for help, and promised them honours.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then they entered into fellowship with Thorir and his men; for they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were exceeding fain to try their strength, and said that there would
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they be whereas the fight was hottest.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now was the meeting with Harald the King in Rogaland, in that firth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: which is called Hafrsfirth; and both sides had many men. This was the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: greatest battle that has ever been fought in Norway, and hereof most
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Sagas tell; for of those is ever most told, of whom the Sagas are
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: made; and thereto came folk from all the land, and many from other
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: lands and swarms of vikings.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Onund laid his ship alongside one board of the ship of Thorir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Longchin, about the midst of the fleet, but King Harald laid his on
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the other board, because Thorir was the greatest bearserk, and the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: stoutest of men; so the fight was of the fiercest on either side. Then
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the king cried on his bearserks for an onslaught, and they were called
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Wolf-coats, for on them would no steel bite, and when they set
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: on nought might withstand them. Thorir defended him very stoutly, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fell in all hardihood on board his ship; then was it cleared from stem
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to stern, and cut from the grapplings, and let drift astern betwixt
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the other ships. Thereafter the king's men laid their ship alongside
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund's, and he was in the forepart thereof and fought manly; then the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: king's folk said, "Lo, a forward man in the forecastle there, let him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: have somewhat to mind him how that he was in this battle." Now Onund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: put one foot out over the bulwark and dealt a blow at a man, and even
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: therewith a spear was aimed at him, and as he put the blow from him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he bent backward withal, and one of the king's forecastle men smote
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: at him, and the stroke took his leg below the knee and sheared it off,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and forthwith made him unmeet for fight. Then fell the more part of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the folk on board his ship; but Onund was brought to the ship of him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: who is called Thrand; he was the son of Biorn, and brother of Eyvind
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Eastman; he was in the fight against King Harald and lay on the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: other board of Onund's ship.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But now, after these things, the more part of the fleet scattered in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: flight; Thrand and his men, with the other vikings, got them away each
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: as he might, and sailed west over the Sea; Onund went with him, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Balk and Hallvard Sweeping; Onund was healed, but went with a wooden
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: leg all his life after; therefore as long as he lived was he called
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund Treefoot.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: CHAP. III.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: At that time were many great men west over the Sea, such as had fled
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: from their lands in Norway before King Harald, because he had made
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: all those outlaws, who had met him in battle, and taken to him their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: possessions. So, when Onund was healed of his wounds, he and Thrand
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: went to meet Geirmund Helskin, because he was the most famed of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: vikings west there over the Sea, and they asked him whether he had any
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: mind to seek after that kingdom which he had in Hordaland, and offered
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: him their fellowship herein; for they deemed they had a sore loss of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their lands there, since Onund was both mighty and of great kin.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Geirmund said that so great had grown the strength of King Harald,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that he deemed there was little hope that they would win honour in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their war with him when men had been worsted, even when all the folk
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of the land had been drawn together; and yet withal that he was loth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to become a king's thrall and pray for that which was his own; that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he would find somewhat better to do than that; and now, too, he was no
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: longer young. So Onund and his fellows went back to the South-isles,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and there met many of their friends.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There was a man, Ufeigh by name, who was bynamed Grettir; he was the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: son of Einar, the son of Olvir Bairn-Carle; he was brother to Oleif
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Broad, the father of Thormod Shaft; Steinulf was the name of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Olvir Bairn-Carle's son, he was the father of Una whom Thorbiorn
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Salmon-Carle had to wife. Another son of Olvir Bairn-Carle was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Steinmod, the father of Konal, who was the father of Aldis of Barra.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: The son of Konal was Steinmod, the father of Haldora, the wife of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Eilif, the son of Ketil the Onehanded. Ufeigh Grettir had to wife
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Asny, the daughter of Vestar Haengson; and Asmund the Beardless and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Asbiorn were the sons of Ufeigh Grettir, but his daughters were these,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Aldis, and Asa, and Asvor. Ufeigh had fled away west over the Sea
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: before Harald the king, and so had Thormod Shaft his kinsman, and had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with them their kith and kin; and they harried in Scotland, and far
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and wide west beyond the sea.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Thrand and Onund Treefoot made west for Ireland to find Eyvind

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: There were two vikings called Vigbiod and Vestmar; they were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: till Eyvind the Eastman took the land-wardship; thereafter they got
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: them gone to the South-isles, and harried there and all about the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: firths of Scotland: against these went Thrand and Onund, and heard
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that they had sailed to that island, which is called Bute. Now Onund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and his folk came there with five ships; and when the vikings see
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their ships and know how many they are, they deem they have enough
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: strength gathered there, and take their weapons and lay their ships in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the midst betwixt two cliffs, where was a great and deep sound; only
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: once. Now Onund was the wisest of men, and bade lay five ships up into
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the sound, so that he and his might have back way when they would, for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: might not be seen withal from the ships.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: the sea, and went out to Iceland, for from thence came tales of land

text: And now it came to pass that Biorn, the father of Thrand, died; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But that autumn Grim the hersir slew Ondott Crow, because he might
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: not get the heritage-money for the king; and that same night of his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slaying, Signy, his wife, brought aboard ship all her chattels, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fared with her sons, Asmund and Asgrim, to Sighvat her father; but a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: little after sent her sons to Soknadale to Hedin her foster-father;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: but that seemed good to them but for a little while, and they would
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fain go back again to their mother; so they departed and came at
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Yule-tide to Ingiald the Trusty at Hvin; he took them in because of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the urgency of Gyda his wife, and they were there the winter through.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But in spring came Onund north to Agdir, because he had heard of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slaying of Ondott Crow; but when he found Signy he asked her what help
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: she would have of him.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: She said that she would fain have vengeance on Grim the hersir for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the slaying of Ondott. Then were the sons of Ondott sent for, and when
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they met Onund Treefoot, they made up one fellowship together, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had spies abroad on the doings of Grim. Now in the summer was a great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ale-drinking held at Grim's, because he had bidden to him Earl Audun;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and when Onund and the sons of Ondott knew thereof they went to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grim's homestead and laid fire to the house, for they were come there
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unawares, and burnt Grim the hersir therein, and nigh thirty men, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: many good things they took there withal. Then went Onund to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: woods, but the sons of Ondott took a boat of Ingiald's, their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: foster-father's, and rowed away therein, and lay hid a little way off
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the homestead. Earl Audun came to the feast, even as had been settled
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: afore, and there "missed friend from stead." Then he gathered men to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: him, and dwelt there some nights, but nought was heard of Onund and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his fellows; and the Earl slept in a loft with two men.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund had full tidings from the homestead, and sent after those
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: brothers; and, when they met, Onund asked them whether they would
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: watch the farm or fall on the Earl; but they chose to set on the Earl.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So they drove beams at the loft-doors and broke them in; then Asmund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: caught hold of the two who were with the Earl, and cast them down so
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: hard that they were well-nigh slain; but Asgrim ran at the Earl, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bade him render up weregild for his father, since he had been in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the plot and the onslaught with Grim the hersir when Ondott Crow was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slain. The Earl said he had no money with him there, and prayed for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: delay of that payment. Then Asgrim set his spear-point to the Earl's
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: breast and bade him pay there and then; so the Earl took a chain from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his neck, and three gold rings, and a cloak of rich web, and gave them
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: up. Asgrim took the goods and gave the Earl a name, and called him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Audun Goaty.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But when the bonders and neighbouring folk were ware that war was come
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: among them, they went abroad and would bring help to the Earl, and a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: hard fight there was, for Onund had many men, and there fell many good
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bonders and courtmen of the Earl. Now came the brothers, and told how
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they had fared with the Earl, and Onund said that it was ill that he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was not slain, "that would have been somewhat of a revenge on the King
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for our loss at his hands of fee and friends." They said that this
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was a greater shame to the Earl; and therewith they went away up to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Sorreldale to Eric Alefain, a king's lord, and he took them in for all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the winter.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now at Yule they drank turn and turn about with a man called
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Hallstein, who was bynamed Horse; Eric gave the first feast, well and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: truly, and then Hallstein gave his, but thereat was there bickering
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: between them, and Hallstein smote Eric with a deer-horn; Eric gat no
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: revenge therefor, but went home straightway. This sore misliked
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the sons of Ondott, and a little after Asgrim fared to Hallstein's
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: homestead, and went in alone, and gave him a great wound, but those
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: who were therein sprang up and set on Asgrim. Asgrim defended himself
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: well and got out of their hands in the dark; but they deemed they had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: slain him.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund and Asmund heard thereof and supposed him dead, but deemed they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: might do nought. Eric counselled them to make for Iceland, and said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that would be of no avail to abide there in the land (i.e. in Norway),
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: as soon as the king should bring matters about to his liking. So
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: this they did, and made them ready for Iceland and had each one ship.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Hallstein lay wounded, and died before Onund and his folk sailed.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Kolbein withal, who is afore mentioned, went abroad with Onund.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: CHAP. VIII.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Onund and Asmund sailed into the sea when they were ready, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: held company together; then sang Onund this stave--
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Meet was I in days agone
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: For storm, wherein the Sweeping One,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Midst rain of swords, and the darts' breath,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Blew o'er all a gale of death.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now a maimed, one-footed man
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: On rollers' steed through waters wan
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Out to Iceland must I go;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Ah, the skald is sinking low."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They had a hard voyage of it and much of baffling gales from the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: south, and drove north into the main; but they made Iceland, and were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: by then come to the north off Longness when they found where they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were: so little space there was betwixt them that they spake together;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and Asmund said that they had best sail to Islefirth, and thereto they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: both agreed; then they beat up toward the land, and a south-east wind
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sprang up; but when Onund and his folk laid the ship close to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wind, the yard was sprung; then they took in sail, and therewith were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: driven off to sea; but Asmund got under the lee of Brakeisle, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there lay till a fair wind brought him into Islefirth; Helgi the Lean
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: gave him all Kraeklings' lithe, and he dwelt at South Glass-river;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Asgrim his brother came out some winters later and abode at North
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Glass-river; he was the father of Ellida-Grim, the father of Asgrim
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Ellida-Grimson.

text: CHAP. IX.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now it is to be told of Onund Treefoot that he drave out to sea for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: certain days, but at last the wind got round to the north, and they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sailed for land: then those knew who had been there before that they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had come west off the Skagi; then they sailed into Strand-Bay, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: near to the South-Strands, and there rowed toward them six men in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a ten-oared boat, who hailed the big ship, and asked who was their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: captain; Onund named himself, and asked whence they came; they said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they were house-carles of Thorvald, from Drangar; Onund asked if all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: land through the Strands had been settled; they said there was little
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unsettled in the inner Strands, and none north thereof. Then Onund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: asked his shipmates, whether they would make for the west country, or
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: take such as they had been told of; they chose to view the land first.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So they sailed in up the bay, and brought to in a creek off Arness,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: then put forth a boat and rowed to land. There dwelt a rich man,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Eric Snare, who had taken land betwixt Ingolfs-firth, and Ufoera in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Fishless; but when Eric knew that Onund was come there, he bade him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: take of his hands whatso he would, but said that there was little that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had not been settled before. Onund said he would first see what there
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was, so they went landward south past some firths, till they came to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Ufoera; then said Eric, "Here is what there is to look to; all from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: here is unsettled, and right in to the settlements of Biorn." Now a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: great mountain went down the eastern side of the firth, and snow had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fallen thereon, Onund looked on that mountain, and sang--
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Brand-whetter's life awry doth go.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Fair lands and wide full well I know;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Past house, and field, and fold of man,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: The swift steed of the rollers ran:
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: My lands, and kin, I left behind,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: That I this latter day might find,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Coldback for sunny meads to have;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Hard fate a bitter bargain drave."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Eric answered, "Many have lost so much in Norway, that it may not be
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bettered: and I think withal that most lands in the main-settlements
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: are already settled, and therefore I urge thee not to go from hence;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: but I shall hold to what I spake, that thou mayst have whatso of my
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: lands seems meet to thee." Onund said, that he would take that offer,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and so he settled land out from Ufoera over the three creeks, Byrgis
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Creek, Kolbein's Creek, and Coldback Creek, up to Coldback Cleft.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thereafter Eric gave him all Fishless, and Reekfirth, and all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Reekness, out on that side of the firth; but as to drifts there was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: nought set forth, for they were then so plentiful that every man had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of them what he would. Now Onund set up a household at Coldback, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had many men about him; but when his goods began to grow great he had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: another stead in Reekfirth. Kolbein dwelt at Kolbein's Creek. So Onund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: abode in peace for certain winters.

author: NA

text: CHAP. X.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Onund was so brisk a man, that few, even of whole men, could cope
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with him; and his name withal was well known throughout the land,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: because of his forefathers. After these things, befell that strife
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: betwixt Ufeigh Grettir and Thorbiorn Earl's-champion, which had such
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ending, that Ufeigh fell before Thorbiorn in Grettir's-Gill, near
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Heel. There were many drawn together to the sons of Ufeigh concerning
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the blood-suit, and Onund Treefoot was sent for, and rode south in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the spring, and guested at Hvamm, with Aud the Deeply-wealthy, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: she gave him exceeding good welcome, because he had been with her west
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: over the Sea. In those days, Olaf Feilan, her son's son, was a man
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: full grown, and Aud was by then worn with great eld; she bade Onund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: know that she would have Olaf, her kinsman, married, and was fain that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he should woo Aldis of Barra, who was cousin to Asa, whom Onund had to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wife. Onund deemed the matter hopeful, and Olaf rode south with him.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So when Onund met his friends and kin-in-law they bade him abide with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: them: then was the suit talked over, and was laid to Kialarnes Thing,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for as then the Althing was not yet set up. So the case was settled
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: by umpiredom, and heavy weregild came for the slayings, and Thorbiorn
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Earl's-champion was outlawed. His son was Solmund, the father of Kari
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Singed; father and son dwelt abroad a long time afterwards.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thrand bade Onund and Olaf to his house, and so did Thormod Shaft, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they backed Olaf's wooing, which was settled with ease, because men
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: knew how mighty a woman Aud was. So the bargain was made, and, so much
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: being done, Onund rode home, and Aud thanked him well for his help to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Olaf. That autumn Olaf Feilan wedded Aldis of Barra; and then died Aud
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Deeply-wealthy, as is told in the story of the Laxdale men.

text: CHAP. XI.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Onund and Asa had two sons; the elder was called Thorgeir, the younger
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Ufeigh Grettir; but Asa soon died. Thereafter Onund got to wife a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: woman called Thordis, the daughter of Thorgrim, from Gnup in Midfirth,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and akin to Midfirth Skeggi. Of her Onund had a son called Thorgrim;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he was early a big man, and a strong, wise, and good withal in matters
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of husbandry. Onund dwelt on at Coldback till he was old, then he died
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in his bed, and is buried in Treefoot's barrow; he was the briskest
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and lithest of one-footed men who have ever lived in Iceland.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Thorgrim took the lead among the sons of Onund, though others of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: them were older than he; but when he was twenty-five years old he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: grew grey-haired, and therefore was he bynamed Greypate; Thordis, his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: mother, was afterwards wedded north in Willowdale, to Audun Skokul,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and their son was Asgeir, of Asgeir's-River. Thorgrim Greypate and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his brothers had great possessions in common, nor did they divide the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: goods between them. Now Eric, who farmed at Arness, as is aforesaid,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had to wife Alof, daughter of Ingolf, of Ingolfs-firth; and Flosi was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the name of their son, a hopeful man, and of many friends. In those
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: days three brothers came out hither, Ingolf, Ufeigh, and Eyvind, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: settled those three firths that are known by their names, and there
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: dwelt afterwards. Olaf was the name of Eyvind's son, he first dwelt
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: at Eyvind's-firth, and after at Drangar, and was a man to hold his own
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: well.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now there was no strife betwixt these men while their elders were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: alive; but when Eric died, it seemed to Flosi, that those of Coldback
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had no lawful title to the lands which Eric had given to Onund; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: from this befell much ill-blood betwixt them; but Thorgrim and his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kin still held their lands as before, but they might not risk having
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sports together. Now Thorgeir was head-man of the household of those
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: brothers in Reekfirth, and would ever be rowing out a-fishing, because
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in those days were the firths full of fish; so those in the Creek
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: made up their plot; a man there was, a house-carle of Flosi in Arness,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: called Thorfin, him Flosi sent for Thorgeir's head, and he went and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: hid himself in the boat-stand; that morning, Thorgeir got ready to row
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: out to sea, and two men with him, one called Hamund, the other Brand.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Thorgeir went first, and had on his back a leather bottle and drink

text: In those days befell such hard times in Iceland, that nought like them
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: drifts, came to an end; and this went on for many seasons. One autumn
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Now the lord who dwelt in the island was called Thorfinn; he was the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: great chief.

author: NA

text: But when day was fully come men saw from the island that the chapmen
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were brought to great straits. This was made known to Thorfinn, and he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: tale.

text: Grettir was left behind with Thorfinn, and little he stirred, and was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and would not go out with him in the day; this Thorfinn took ill, but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: had not the heart to have food withheld from him.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: the island.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There was a man called Audun who dwelt at Windham; thither Grettir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: went every day, and he made friends with Audun, and there he was wont
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: But before Earl Eric went away from the land, he called together lords
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and rich bonders, and many things they spoke on laws and the rule of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the land, for Earl Eric was a man good at rule. Now men thought it an
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: This summer Grettir Asmundson came out to Skagafirth: he was in those
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: days so famed a man for strength and prowess, that none was deemed
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his like among young men. He rode home to Biarg forthwith, and Asmund
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: welcomed him meetly. At that time Atli managed the farming matters,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and well things befell betwixt the brothers.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But now Grettir waxed so overbearing, that he deemed that nought was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: too much for him to do. At that time had many men grown into full
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: manhood who were young in the days when Grettir was wont to play with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: them on Midfirth-water before he went abroad; one of these was Audun,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: who then dwelt at Audunstead, in Willowdale; he was the son of Asgeir,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the son of Audun, the son of Asgeir Madpate; of all men he was the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: strongest north there; but he was thought to be the gentlest of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: neighbours. Now it came into Grettir's mind that he had had the worst
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Audun in that ball-play whereof is told before; and now he would
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fain try which of the twain had ripened the most since then. For this
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: cause Grettir took his way from home, and fared unto Audunstead.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: This was in early mowing tide; Grettir was well dight, and rode in a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fair-stained saddle of very excellent workmanship, which Thorfinn had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: given him; a good horse he had withal, and all weapons of the best.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir came early in the day to Audunstead, and knocked at the door.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Few folk were within; Grettir asked if Audun was at home. Men said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that he had gone to fetch victuals from the hill-dairy. Then Grettir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: took the bridle off his horse; the field was unmowed, and the horse
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: went whereas the grass was the highest. Grettir went into the hall,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sat down on the seat-beam, and thereon fell asleep. Soon after Audun
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: came home, and sees a horse grazing in the field with a fair-stained
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: saddle on; Audun was bringing victuals on two horses, and carried
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: curds on one of them, in drawn-up hides, tied round about: this
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fashion men called curd-bags. Audun took the loads off the horses and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: carried the curd-bags in his arms into the house.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now it was dark before his eyes, and Grettir stretched his foot from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: out the beam so that Audun fell flat down head-foremost on to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: curd-bag, whereby the bonds of the bag brake; Audun leaped up and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: asked who was that rascal in the way. Grettir named himself.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then said Audun, "Rashly hast thou done herein; what is thine errand
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: then?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir said, "I will fight with thee."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "First I will see about my victuals," said Audun.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "That thou mayst well do," said Grettir, "if thou canst not charge
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: other folk therewith."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then Audun stooped down and caught up the curd-bag and dashed it
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: against Grettir's bosom, and bade him first take what was sent him;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: shame he deemed that than if Audun had given him a great wound.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now thereon they rushed at one another and wrestled fiercely; Grettir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: set on with great eagerness, but Audun gave back before him. Yet he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: feels that Grettir has outgrown him in strength. Now all things in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their way were kicked out of place, and they were borne on wrestling
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to and fro throughout all the hall; neither spared his might, but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: still Grettir was the toughest of the twain, and at last Audun fell,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: having torn all weapons from Grettir.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: around them. Withal a great din was heard coming through the earth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: underneath the farmstead, and Grettir heard some one ride up to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: houses, get off his horse, and stride in with great strides; he sees
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a man come up, of goodly growth, in a red kirtle and with a helmet on
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his head. He took his way into the hall, for he had heard clamorous
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: the hall.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Grettir named himself, "But who asks thereof?" quoth he.

text: "Bardi am I hight," said the new comer.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: "Art thou Bardi, the son of Gudmund, from Asbiornsness?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "That very man am I," said Bardi; "but what art thou doing?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir said, "We, Audun and I, are playing here in sport."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "I know not as to the sport thereof," said Bardi, "nor are ye even men
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: either; thou art full of unfairness and overbearing, and he is easy
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and good to deal with; so let him stand up forthwith."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Grettir said, "Many a man stretches round the door to the lock;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and meseems it lies more in thy way to avenge thy brother Hall[12]
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: than to meddle in the dealings betwixt me and Audun."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: [Footnote 12: Who was killed in Norway by the sons of Harek, and whose
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: "Prithee, Audun, who can tell,

text: But that now thy throat shall swell;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: That from rough hands thou shalt gain

author: NA

text: By our strife a certain pain.

author: NA

text: E'en such wrong as I have done,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: I of yore from Audun won,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: When the young, fell-creeping lad
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: At his hands a choking had."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to avenge himself.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: part, leaving things as they are, that thereby there may be an end of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: all between you."

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: brothers.

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now they all rode off, and when they were somewhat on their way,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

text: CHAP. XXIX.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Of the Horse-fight at Longfit.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: That summer was settled to be a great horse-fight at Longfit, below
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Reeks. Thither came many men. Atli of Biarg had a good horse, a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: black-maned roan of Keingala's kin, and father and son had great love
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for that horse. The brothers, Kormak and Thorgils of Meal, had a brown
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: horse, trusty in fight. These were to fight their horse against Atli
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Biarg. And many other good horses were there.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Odd, the Foundling-skald, of Kormak's kin, was to follow the horse
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of his kinsman through the day. Odd was then growing a big man, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bragged much of himself, and was untameable and reckless. Grettir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: asked of Atli his brother, who should follow his horse.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "I am not so clear about that," said he.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Wilt thou that I stand by it?" said Grettir.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Be thou then very peaceable, kinsman," said Atli, "for here have we
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to deal with overbearing men."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Well, let them pay for their own insolence," said Grettir, "if they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: know not how to hold it back."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: together. There was a deep hollow in the river down below the bank.

author: NA

text: The horses bit well at each other, and the greatest sport it was.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: seized the tail with one hand, and the staff wherewith he goaded the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: horse he held in the other. Odd stood far before his horse, nor was it
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: so sure that he did not goad Atli's horse from his hold. Grettir made
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: as if he saw it not. Now the horses bore forth towards the river. Then
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

author: NA

text: that the flesh shrank from under it, but Grettir was little scratched.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: <i>Of Thorbiorn Oxmain and Thorbiorn Tardy, and of Grettir's meeting

text: Thorbiorn was the name of a man who dwelt at Thorodstead in Ramfirth;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he was the son of Arnor Hay-nose,[13] the son of Thorod, who had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: settled Ramfirth on that side out as far as Bank was on the other.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: [Footnote 13: In the Landnama he is called 'Hy-nef;' the meaning is
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: doubtful, but it seems that the author of this history means to call
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: him Hay-nose.]
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorbiorn was the strongest of all men; he was called Oxmain. Thorod
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was the name of his brother, he was called Drapa-Stump; their mother
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was Gerd, daughter of Bodvar, from Bodvars-knolls. Thorbiorn was a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: great and hardy warrior, and had many men with him; he was noted as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was the name of Gamli's brother; he was of all men the swiftest; he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: rode with Grettir with another man; they were five in all. Thus they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: stands a huge stone that is called Grettir's heave; for he tried long
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

text: after their parting with Grettir.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They were the sons of Gudmund, the son of Solmund. The mother of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Solmund was Thorlaug, the daughter of Saemund, the South-Island man,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the foster-brother of Ingimund the Old, and Bardi was a very noble
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: man.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now soon he rode to find Thorarin the Wise, his foster-father. He
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: welcomed Bardi well, and asked what gain he had got of followers and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: aid, for they had before taken counsel over Bardi's journey. Bardi
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: answered that he had got the aid of that man to his fellow, whose aid
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he deemed better than that of any other twain. Thorarin got silent
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thereat, and then said,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "That man will be Grettir Asmundson."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Sooth is the sage's guess," said Bardi; "that is the very man,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: foster-father."

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: man of those who are to choose in our land, and late will he be won
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with weapons, if he be hale, yet it misdoubts me how far he will bring
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thee luck; but of thy following all must not be luckless, and enough
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: have my will."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wouldst grudge me the aid of the bravest of men, if my need should be
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: hard. A man cannot foresee all things when he is driven on as methinks
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: I am."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: foresight."

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: from the south: he fared from the homestead up on to the hill-side,

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bent on doing us harm. I now shall send after men to Thorey's-peak,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: and stake nought on the chance of his ill-will."

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: not fight with me."

text: <i>Of the Haunting at Thorhall-stead; and how Thorhall took a Shepherd
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA
