title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There was a man hight Thorhall, who dwelt at Thorhall-stead, in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Shady-vale, which runs up from Waterdale. Thorhall was the son of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grim, son of Thorhall, the son of Fridmund, who settled Shady-vale.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorhall had a wife hight Gudrun. Grim was their son, and Thurid their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: daughter; they were well-nigh grown up.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorhall was a rich man, but mostly in cattle, so that no man had so
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: much of live-stock as he. He was no chief, but an honest bonder he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was. Much was that place haunted, and hardly could he get a shepherd
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that he deemed should serve his turn. He sought counsel of many men
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: as to what he might do therewith, but none gave him a rede that might
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: serve him. Thorhall rode each summer to the Thing, and good horses
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he had. But one summer at the Althing, Thorhall went to the booth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Skapti Thorodson the Lawman. Skapti was the wisest of men, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wholesome were his redes when folk prayed him for them. But he and his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: father differed thus much, that Thorod was foretelling, and yet was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: called under-handed of some folk; but Skapti showed forth to every
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: man what he deemed would avail most, if it were not departed from,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: therefore was he called "Father-betterer."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Thorhall went into Skapti's booth, and Skapti greeted him well,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for he knew that he was a man rich in cattle, and he asked him what
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were the tidings.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorhall answered, "A wholesome counsel would I have from thee."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Little am I meet for that," said Skapti; "but what dost thou stand in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: need of?"

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: do my shepherds avail me; for ever will they get badly hurt; but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: when he knows what bides in the way."

text: folk."

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: <i>Olaf the Saint, King in Norway; the slaying of Thorbiorn Tardy;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir goes to Norway.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Early the spring after came out a ship from Norway; and that was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: before the Thing; these folk knew many things to tell, and first that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there was change of rulers in Norway, for Olaf Haraldson was come to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: be king, and Earl Svein had fled the country in the spring after the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fight at Ness. Many noteworthy matters were told of King Olaf, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: this withal, that he received such men in the best of ways who were of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: prowess in any deeds, and that he made such his men.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thereat were many young men glad, and listed to go abroad, and when
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir heard the tidings he became much minded to sail out; for he,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: like others, hoped for honour at the king's hands.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: A ship lay in Goose-ere in Eyjafirth, therein Grettir got him a berth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and made ready for the voyage, nor had he yet much of faring-goods.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Asmund was growing very feeble with eld, and was well-nigh
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bedridden; he and Asdis had a young son who was called Illugi, and was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the hopefullest of men; and, by this time, Atli tended all farming and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: money-keeping, and this was deemed to better matters, because he was a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: peaceable and foreseeing man.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Grettir went shipward, but in that same ship had Thorbiorn the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Tardy taken passage, before folk knew that Grettir would sail therein.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now men would hinder Thorbiorn from sailing in the same ship with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir, but Thorbiorn said that he would go for all that. He gat him
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ready for the voyage out, and was somewhat late thereat, nor did he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: come to the north to Goose-ere before the ship was ready for sea; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: before Thorbiorn fared from the west, Asmund the Greyhaired fell sick
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and was bedridden.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Thorbiorn the Tardy came late one day down to the sand; men were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: getting ready to go to table, and were washing their hands outside the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: booths; but when Thorbiorn rode up the lane betwixt the booths, he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was greeted, and asked for tidings. He made as if there was nought
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to tell, "Save that I deem that Asmund, the champion of Biarg, is now
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: dead."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Many men said that there where he went, departed a worthy goodman from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the world.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "But what brought it about?" said they.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: He answered, "Little went to the death of that champion, for in the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: chamber smoke was he smothered like a dog; nor is there loss therein,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: for he was grown a dotard."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Thou speakest marvellously of such a man," said they, "nor would
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir like thy words well, if he heard them."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "That must I bear," said Thorbiorn, "and higher must Grettir bear the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sword than he did last summer at Ramfirth-neck, if I am to tremble at
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: him."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Grettir heard full well what Thorbiorn said, and paid no heed
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thereto while he let his tale run on; but when he had made an end,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: then spake Grettir--
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "That fate I foretell for thee, Tardy," said he, "that thou wilt not
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: die in chamber smoke, yet may be withal thou wilt not die of eld; but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: it is strangely done to speak scorn of sackless men."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorbiorn said, "I have no will to hold in about these things, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: methinks thou didst not bear thyself so briskly when we got thee off
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that time when the men of Meals beat thee like a neat's head."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then sang Grettir--
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Day by day full over long,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Arrow-dealer, grows thy tongue;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Such a man there is, that thou
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Mayst be paid for all words now;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Many a man, who has been fain,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Wound-worm's tower with hands to gain,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: With less deeds his death has bought,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Than thou, Tardy-one, hast wrought."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Said Thorbiorn, "About as feign do I deem myself as before, despite
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thy squealing."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir answered, "Heretofore my spaedom has not been long-lived, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: so shall things go still; now beware if thou wilt, hereafter will no
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: out-look be left."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Therewith Grettir hewed at Thorbiorn, but he swung up his hand, with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the mind to ward the stroke from him, but that stroke came on his arm
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: about the wrist, and withal the short-sword drave into his neck so
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that the head was smitten off.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then said the chapmen that he was a man of mighty strokes, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that such should king's men be; and no scathe they deemed it though
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorbiorn were slain, in that he had been both quarrelsome and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: spiteful.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: A little after they sailed into the sea, and came in late summer to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Norway, south at Hordaland, and then they heard that King Olaf was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: north at Drontheim; then Grettir took ship in a trading keel to go
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: north therefrom, because he would fain see the king.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

author: NA

text: CHAP. XXXVIII.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: <i>Of Thorir of Garth and his sons; and how Grettir fetched fire for
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his shipmates.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There was a man named Thorir, who lived at Garth, in Maindale, he was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the son of Skeggi, the son of Botulf. Skeggi had settled Well-wharf up
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to Well-ness; he had to wife Helga, daughter of Thorkel, of Fishbrook;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorir, his son, was a great chief, and a seafaring man. He had two
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sons, one called Thorgeir and one Skeggi, they were both hopeful men,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and fully grown in those days. Thorir had been in Norway that summer,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: when King Olaf came east from England, and got into great friendship
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with the king, and with Bishop Sigurd as well; and this is a token
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thereof, that Thorir had had a large ship built in the wood, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: prayed Bishop Sigurd to hallow it, and so he did. Thereafter Thorir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fared out to Iceland and caused the ship to be broken up, when he grew
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: weary of sailing, but the beaks of the ship, he had set up over his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outer door, and they were there long afterwards, and were so full of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: weather wisdom, that the one whistled before a south wind, and the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: other before a north wind.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But when Thorir knew that King Olaf had got the sole rule over all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Norway, he deemed that he had some friendship there to fall back on;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: then he sent his sons to Norway to meet the king, and was minded that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they should become his men. They came there south, late in autumn, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: got to themselves a row-barge, and fared north along the land, with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the mind to go and meet the king.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They came to a haven south of Stead, and lay there some nights, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kept themselves in good case as to meat and drink, and were not much
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: abroad when the weather was foul.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now it is to be told that Grettir and his fellows fared north
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: along the land, and often had hard weather, because it was then the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: beginning of winter; and when they bore down north on Stead, they had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: much foul weather, with snow and frost, and with exceeding trouble
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they make land one evening all much worn with wet; so they lay to by
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a certain dyke, and could thus save their money and goods; the chapmen
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were hard put to it for the cold, because they could not light any
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fire, though thereon they deemed well-nigh their life and health lay.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thus they lay that evening in evil plight; but as the night wore on
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they saw that a great fire sprang up in the midst of the sound over
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: against there whereas they had come. But when Grettir's shipmates saw
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the fire, they said one to the other that he would be a happy man who
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: might get it, and they doubted whether they should unmoor the ship,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: but to all of them there seemed danger in that. Then they had a long
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: talk over it, whether any man was of might enow to fetch that fire.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir gave little heed thereto, but said, that such men had been as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: would not have feared the task. The chapmen said that they were not
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bettered by what had been, if now there was nought to take to.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Perchance thou deemest thyself man enough thereto, Grettir," said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: they, "since thou art called the man of most prowess among the men of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Iceland, and thou wottest well enough what our need is."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir answered, "It seems to me no great deed to fetch the fire, but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: I wot not if ye will reward it according to the prayer of him who does
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: it."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They said, "Why deemest thou us such shameful men as that we should
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: reward that deed but with good?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Quoth he, "I may try this if so be that ye think much lies on it, but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: my mind bids me hope to get nought of good thereby."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They said that that should never be, and bade all hail to his words;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and thereafter Grettir made ready for swimming, and cast his clothes
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: from off him; of clothes he had on but a cape and sail-cloth breeches;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he girt up the cape and tied a bast-rope strongly round his middle,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and had with him a cask; then he leaped overboard; he stretched across
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the sound, and got aland.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: There he saw a house stand, and heard therefrom the talk of men, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: much clatter, and therewith he turned toward that house.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now is it to be said of those that were there before, that here were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: come the sons of Thorir, as is aforesaid; they had lain there many
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: nights, and bided there the falling of the gale, that they might
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: have wind at will to go north, beyond Stead. They had set them down
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a-drinking, and were twelve men in all; their ship rode in the main
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: haven, and they were at a house of refuge for such men to guest in, as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: went along the coast.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Much straw had been borne into the house, and there was a great fire
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: on the floor; Grettir burst into the house, and wotted not who was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: there before; his cape was all over ice when he came aland, and he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: himself was wondrous great to behold, even as a troll; now those first
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: comers were exceeding amazed at him, and deemed he must be some evil
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wight; they smote at him with all things they might lay hold of, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: mighty din went on around them; but Grettir put off all blows strongly
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with his arms, then some smote him with fire-brands, and the fire
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: burst off over all the house, and therewith he got off with the fire
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and fared back again to his fellows.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: They mightily praised his journey and the prowess of it, and said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that his like would never be. And now the night wore, and they deemed
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: themselves happy in that they had got the fire.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: The next morning the weather was fair; the chapmen woke early and got
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: them ready to depart, and they talked together that now they should
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: meet those who had had the rule of that fire, and wot who they were.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now they unmoored their ship, and crossed over the sound; there they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: found no hall, but saw a great heap of ashes, and found therein many
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bones of men; then they deemed that this house of refuge had been
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: utterly burned up, with all those men who had been therein.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thereat they asked if Grettir had brought about that ill-hap, and said
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that it was the greatest misdeed.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir said, that now had come to pass even as he had misdoubted,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that they should reward him ill for the fetching of the fire, and that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: it was ill to help unmanly men.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir got such hurt of this, that the chapmen said, wheresoever they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: came, that Grettir had burned those men. The news soon got abroad that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in that house were lost the aforenamed sons of Thorir of Garth, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their fellows; then they drave Grettir from their ship and would not
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: have him with them; and now he became so ill looked on that scarce any
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: one would do good to him.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now he deemed that matters were utterly hopeless, but before all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: things would go to meet the king, and so made north to Drontheim. The
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: king was there before him, and knew all or ever Grettir came there,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: who had been much slandered to the king. And Grettir was some days in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the town before he could get to meet the king.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: CHAP. XXXIX.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: How Grettir would fain bear Iron before the King.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now on a day when the king sat in council, Grettir went before the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: king and greeted him well. The king looked at him and said, "Art thou
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir the Strong?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: He answered, "So have I been called, and for that cause am I come to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thee, that I hope from thee deliverance from the evil tale that is
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: laid on me, though I deem that I nowise wrought that deed."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: King Olaf said, "Thou art great enough, but I know not what luck thou
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: mayest bear about to cast off this matter from thee; but it is like,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: indeed, that thou didst not willingly burn the men."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir said he was fain to put from him this slander, if the king
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thought he might do so; the king bade him tell truthfully, how it had

text: When Grettir came over Codfirth-heath down into Longdale, he swept up
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unsparingly the goods of the petty bonders, and had of every man what
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: gave up in very unlike ways; but as soon as he was gone, all said they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: In those days dwelt in Waterfirth Vermund the Slender, the brother of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Slaying-Styr; he had to wife Thorbiorg, the daughter of Olaf Peacock,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: son of Hoskuld. She was called Thorbiorg the Big; but at the time that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Now Grettir went over the neck to Bathstead. There dwelt a man called
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: man called Thorir Redbeard; he was the biggest of men, and a great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: to the shore.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: man, and would ever harbour outlawed men.

author: NA

text: There was a man hight Gisli, the son of that Thorstein whom Snorri
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Godi had slain. Gisli was a big man and strong, a man showy in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: weapons and clothes, who made much of himself, and was somewhat of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a self-praiser; he was a seafaring man, and came one summer out to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Whiteriver, whenas Grettir had been a winter on the fell. Thord, son
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Kolbein, rode to his ship, and Gisli gave him good welcome, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bade him take of his wares whatso he would; thereto Thord agreed, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: then they fell to talk one with the other, and Gisli said:
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Is that true which is told me, that ye have no counsel that avails to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: rid you of a certain outlaw who is doing you great ill?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thord said, "We have not tried aught on him yet, but to many he seems
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a man hard to deal with, and that has been proven on many a man."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "It is like, methinks, that you should find Biorn a heavy trouble, if
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ye may not drive away this man: luckless it is for you withal, that I
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: shall be too far off this winter to better matters for you."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Thou wilt be better pleased to deal with him by hearsay."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: "Nay, no need to tell me of Grettir," said Gisli; "I have borne harder
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: brunts when I was in warfare along with King Knut the Mighty, and west
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: over the Sea, and I was ever thought to hold my own; and if I should
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: have a chance at him I would trust myself and my weapons well enough."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thord said he would not work for nought if he prevailed against
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir; "For there is more put upon his head than on the head of any
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: other of wood-folk; six marks of silver it was; but last summer Thorir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Garth laid thereto yet three marks; and men deem he will have
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: enough to do therefor whose lot it is to win it."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: this, nor shall I draw together many men against him."

text: Now Gisli abode at his ship through the autumn till it was rolled
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ashore. Many things made him abide there, so he was ready late, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: day."

text: So this they did, and they were three in all: but when they came west

text: over the river, he spake again to them:

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

author: NA

author: NA

text: of the stones, he spake thus:

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Wet was the weather about that time, and the ways were miry, and a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: certain slough there was to go over or ever they might come to the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: church; and whenas Spes and her company came forth anigh this slough,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a great crowd was there before them, and a multitude of poor folk who
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: prayed them of alms, for this was in the common highway, and all who
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: knew her deemed it was their part to welcome her, and prayed for good
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: things for her as for one who had oft holpen them well.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: A certain staff-propped carle there was amidst those poor folk, great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of growth and long-bearded. Now the women made stay at the slough,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: because that the great people deemed the passage across over miry, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: therewith when that staff-carle saw the goodwife, that she was better
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: arrayed than the other women, he spake to her on this wise,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Good mistress," said he, "be so lowly as to suffer me to bear thee
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: over this slough, for it is the bounden duty of us staff-carles to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: serve thee all we may."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "What then," says she, "wilt thou bear me well, when thou mayst not
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bear thyself?"
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Yet would it show forth thy lowliness," says he, "nor may I offer
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: better than I have withal; and in all things wilt thou fare the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: better, if thou hast no pride against poor folk."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Wot thou well, then," says she, "that if thou bearest me not well it
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: shall be for a beating to thee, or some other shame greater yet."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Well, I would fain risk it," said he; and therewithal he got on to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his feet and stood in the slough. She made as if she were sore afeard
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of his carrying her, yet nathless she went on, borne on his back; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he staggered along exceeding slowly, going on two crutches, and when
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he got midmost of the slough he began to reel from side to side. She
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bade him gather up his strength.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Never shalt thou have made a worse journey than this if thou easiest
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: me down here."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then the poor wretch staggers on, and gathers up all his courage and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: strength, and gets close to the dry land, but stumbles withal, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: falls head-foremost in such wise, that he cast her on to the bank, but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fell into the ditch up to his armpits, and therewithal as he lay there
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: caught at the goodwife, and gat no firm hold of her clothes, but set
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his miry hand on her knee right up to the bare thigh.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: She sprang up and cursed him, and said that ever would evil come from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: wretched gangrel churles: "and thy full due it were to be beaten, if I
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: thought it not a shame, because of thy misery."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then said he, "Meted in unlike ways is man's bliss; me-thought I had
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: done well to thee, and I looked for an alms at thy hands, and lo,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in place thereof, I get but threats and ill-usage and no good again
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: withal;" and he made as if he were exceeding angry.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Many deemed that he looked right poor and wretched, but she said that
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: he was the wiliest of old churles; but whereas many prayed for him,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: she took her purse to her, and therein was many a penny of gold; then
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: she shook down the money and said,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: "Take thou this, carle; nowise good were it, if thou hadst not full
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: pay for the hard words thou hadst of me; now have I parted with thee,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: even according to thy worth."

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then he picked up the gold, and thanked her for her good deed. Spes
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: went to the church, and a great crowd was there before her. Sigurd
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: charges he had brought against her.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: withal, for here matters went as is oft shown that they will, and

text: him, though he had but said the very sooth.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

author: NA

text: meet Harald the king, for to another king have we much more to pay,

author: NA

author: NA

text: after worldly devices, than the teaching of Christ, or the ways of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: So, when they had settled their affairs in this wise, Thorstein bade
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: chosen folk divide his goods into halves; and his kin took the half
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: which his children were to own, and they were brought up by their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: father's kin, and were in aftertimes the mightiest of men, and great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kin in the Wick has come from them. But Thorstein and Spes divided
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: their share of the goods, and some they gave to churches for their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: souls' health, and some they took with them. Then they betook
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: themselves Romeward, and many folk prayed well for them.

text: How Thorstein Dromund and Spes fared to Rome and died there.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: Now they went their ways till they came to Rome-town; and so when they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: came before him, who was appointed to hear the shrifts of men, they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: told him well and truly all things even as they had happed, and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with what cunning and craft they had joined together in wedlock;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: therewithal they gave themselves up with great humility to such
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: penance for the amending of their lives as he should lay on them; but
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: because that they themselves had turned their minds to the atoning
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of their faults, without any urging or anger from the rulers of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: church, they were eased of all fines as much as might be, but were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bidden gently that they should now and henceforth concern themselves
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: reasonably for their souls' health, and from this time forward live in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: chastity, since they had gotten them release from all their guilt; and
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: herewith they were deemed to have fared well and wisely.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Then said Spes, "Now, meseems, our matters have gone well and are come
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to an end, and no unlucky life have we had together; yet maybe fools
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: will do after the pattern of our former life; now therefore let us
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: make such an end to all, that good men also may follow after us and do
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the like: so let us go bargain with those who are deft in stone-craft;
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that they make for each of us a cell of stone, that we may thereby
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: atone for what we have done against God."
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So Thorstein laid down money for the making of a stone cell for each
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of them, and for such-like other things as they might need, and might
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: not be without for the keeping of their lives; and then, when the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: stone work was done, and the time was meet therefor and all things
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were ready, they departed their worldly fellowship of their own free
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: will, that they might the more enjoy a holy fellowship in another
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: world. And there they abode both in their stone cells, and lived as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: long as God would have it, and so ended their lives. And most men say
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that Thorstein Dromund and Spes his wife may be deemed to be folk of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the greatest good luck, all things being accounted of; but neither
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: his children or any of his issue have come to Iceland for a tale to be
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: made of them.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Now Sturla the Lawman says so much as that he deems no outlawed man
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ever to have been so mighty as Grettir the Strong; and thereto he puts
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: forth three reasons--
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: And first in that he was the wisest of them all; for the longest in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outlawry he was of any man, and was never won whiles he was hale.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: And again, in that he was the strongest in all the land among men of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: a like age; and more fitted to lay ghosts and do away with hauntings
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: than any other.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: And thirdly, in that he was avenged out in Micklegarth, even as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: no other man of Iceland has been; and this withal, that Thorstein
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Dromund, who avenged him, was so lucky a man in his last days.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: So here ends the story of Grettir Asmundson, our fellow-countryman.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thank have they who listened thereto; but thank little enow to him who
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: scribbled out the tale.

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: P. 30. 'Now in those times there were wont to be large fire-halls
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: at the homesteads.' The hall, holl, skali, stofa, was the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: principal room in every home. Elda-skali, or fire-hall, as
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the one alluded to at Biarg, was so called from its serving as a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: cooking-hall and a sitting-hall at once. The main features in the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: construction of a hall were the following: it was generally built from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: east to west, in an oblong form, having doors either at one or both
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: ends through the south-side wall, where it met the gable end. These
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: two entrances were called carles'-door and queens'-door (<i>karldyrr,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kvenndyrr), being respectively for the ingress and egress of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: men and women. Sometimes the men's-door was adorned with the beaks
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: (brandar) of a hewn-up ship, as was the case with the hall of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thorir of Garth, standing as door-posts on either side. The door led
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to a front-hall (forkali, fortofa, and-dyri, framhus), which,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: sometimes at least, seems to have been portioned off into an inner
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: room (klefi), or bay, and the vestibule proper. In the bay were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: kept victuals, such as dried fish, flour, and sometimes, no doubt,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: beer. Within, the hall fell into three main portions: the main hall,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: or the nave, and the aisles on either side thereof (skot):
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: The plan of the hall was much like that of one of our regular-built
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: churches without chancel, say like a Suffolk church of the fifteenth
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: century, the nave being lighted by a clerestory, and the aisles
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: running the whole way along the nave, and communicating behind the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: dais. These aisles were used for sleeping-places; so that along the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: whole length of the hall, and behind the dais, all was partitioned
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: into bedsteads, open or locked,--open, that is to say, communicating
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with the nave by a doorless aperture,--locked, that is, shut out of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: view from the nave (lok-rekkja, lok-hvila).
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: On the wall between nave and aisles, which was covered with a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: panelling on its inside at least, were hung the shields and weapons
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of the chief and his retainers, or home-men. Sometimes it was painted
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with mythic subjects, and adorned with fantastic carvings; on great
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: occasions it was covered with hangings. Along both side-walls ran a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: row of seats, called benches (bekkr), the north-most of which,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: or the one which faced the sun, was called the nobler bench (<i>aeethri
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bekkr), the south-most one, the less noble bench, (uoeethri
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bekkr). In the middle of either bench was a seat, called the high
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: seat (oendvegi); that of the nobler bench being occupied by the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: chief or head of the house, unless he had for his guest a man nobler
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: than himself, in which case the latter took it; that of the less noble
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: bench being allotted to the noblest among the guests. The nobler bench
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was on ordinary occasions the bench for the chief and the household.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: The less noble for the guests. In front of the chiefs high-seat were
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: were objects of much veneration, and must always accompany the chief
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: if he moved his abode, and point out his new homestead, if he fared
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: for it over sea, by the spot where they drifted ashore, as, when land

text: P. 169. Hallmund. Our saga is one among the historic sagas of Iceland
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: which deals with traditions of ancient belief in the spirits of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: unknown regions of the land that are interested in the well-being of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the mere men who dwell near them. Hallmund and the giant Thorir are
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the representatives of these powers in our saga. Of these Hallmund is
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the more interesting of the two, both for his human sympathies, his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: tragic end, and the poetry ascribed to him. At one time or other he
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: has had a great name in the Icelandic folk-lore among the spirits of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the land, the so-called land wights (land-voetir), and there is

text: 'In the summer of 1850, when I came north to Axefirth, I heard talk
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: of a Grettir's lair upon Axefirth-peak.... Many who had seen it made
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: September, this summer (1862), I went with the rape-ruler Arni Jonsson
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: of Wood-stead to inspect the lair. Walking up to it from the level
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: ground below took us three minutes. The lair stands in the lower part
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: of a slip of stones beneath some sheer rocks between a sandstone rock,

text: called the carline, and the stone slip from the peak. It is built

text: up of stones, straight as a line, and runs, 4-3/4 ells in length, 10
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: inches broad, and is, within walls, 7/8 of an ell deep. The half of it
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: is deftly covered in with flat stones, the longest of which are 2 ells
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: 9 inches long, and about half an ell in thickness, and a little more

text: in breadth. Small thin fragments of stone are wedged in between these
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: where their junctures do not close tight, and so firmly are they
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: beginning to give way, where the room is covered in. On the outside

text: The hardest thing to account for, or to bring to an intelligible issue
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in Grettir's saga, is the incongruity between the statements as to his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: age at his death and the number of years of his outlawry, as compared
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: with the truthful account of the events told in the saga itself. From
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the time when Grettir slew his first man, all the events of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: saga may be traced clearly year for year up to his death, and their
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: truthfulness is borne out whensoever they chance to run parallel to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: events mentioned in other trustworthy sagas, and they fall in with the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: right time nearly without an exception. But the statement on the page
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: referred to above, that he was fourteen years old when he slew Skeggi,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that he was twenty when he dealt with Glam; twenty-five when he fell
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: into outlawry, and forty-four when he was slain, is utterly confuted
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: by the chronology of the saga itself.

author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong

text: in page 225 about the talk of the time of his outlawry at the Thing.

text: The question is stated to have been this: whether he had been a
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: fraction of the twentieth year an outlaw, his friends hoping that in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: such case a part might count pro toto. But the truth of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: matter was that he had neither been an outlaw for a fraction of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: twentieth year, nor even for anything like nineteen years. He was
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outlawed at the Thing held in 1016, his year of outlawry dated from
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Thing to Thing; this talk befell in 1031, consequently he had been
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: full fifteen years and no fraction of a year in outlawry. The story,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: therefore, of the twenty years, or nineteen years and a fraction, of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outlawry falls utterly to the ground when brought to the test of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: actual facts as recorded in the saga.
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: But, despite of this, it is not to be supposed that this episode at
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the Thing in 1031 is brought in at random and without any cause. There
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: are two obvious reasons for assigning twenty years to the length of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir's outlawry, and for bringing into the tale a discussion on
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: that subject just where it is done. The one we may call the reason of
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: traditional belief, the other the reason of dramatic effect. Grettir
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: was indisputably for all reasons the greatest of Icelandic outlaws,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: and the fond imagination of his biographers at all times urged them
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to give the longest endurance to the time of his outlawry above all
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: outlaws, without inquiring closely as to whether it agreed with
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: the saga itself or not. The other, or the dramatic motive, lies
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: in bringing in the discussion on this long outlawry just at this
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: particular Thing of 1031; for it was obviously the teller's object to
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: suggest to the reader the hope of the great outlaw's legal restoration
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: to the cherished society of man just before the falling of the
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: crushing blow, in order to give an enhanced tragic interest to his
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: end, and he undoubtedly succeeds in doing this. To these reasons,
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: besides others less obvious, we imagine this main inconsistency in
title: The Story of Grettir the Strong
author: NA

text: Grettir's saga is to be ascribed.
